description: Describes the status of the specified instances or all of your instances. By default, only running instances are described, unless you specifically indicate to return the status of all instances. Instance status includes the following components:

parameters.name: InstanceIds
parameters.description: The instance IDs. Default: Describes all your instances. Constraints: Maximum 100 explicitly specified instance IDs. (string) ---

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return for this request. To get the next page of items, make another request with the token returned in the output. For more information, see Pagination. You cannot specify this parameter and the instance IDs parameter in the same request.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filters. availability-zone - The Availability Zone of the instance. event.code - The code for the scheduled event ( instance-reboot | system-reboot | system-maintenance | instance-retirement | instance-stop). event.description - A description of the event. event.instance-event-id - The ID of the event whose date and time you are modifying. event.not-after - The latest end time for the scheduled event (for example, 2014-09-15T17:15:20.000Z). event.not-before - The earliest start time for the scheduled event (for example, 2014-09-15T17:15:20.000Z). event.not-before-deadline - The deadline for starting the event (for example, 2014-09-15T17:15:20.000Z). instance-state-code - The code for the instance state, as a 16-bit unsigned integer. The high byte is used for internal purposes and should be ignored. The low byte is set based on the state represented. The valid values are 0 (pending), 16 (running), 32 (shutting-down), 48 (terminated), 64 (stopping), and 80 (stopped). instance-state-name - The state of the instance ( pending | running | shutting-down | terminated | stopping | stopped). instance-status.reachability - Filters on instance status where the name is reachability ( passed | failed | initializing | insufficient-data). instance-status.status - The status of the instance ( ok | impaired | initializing | insufficient-data | not-applicable). operator.managed - A Boolean that indicates whether this is a managed instance. operator.principal - The principal that manages the instance. Only valid for managed instances, where managed is true. system-status.reachability - Filters on system status where the name is reachability ( passed | failed | initializing | insufficient-data). system-status.status - The system status of the instance ( ok | impaired | initializing | insufficient-data | not-applicable). attached-ebs-status.status - The status of the attached EBS volume for the instance ( ok | impaired | initializing | insufficient-data | not-applicable). (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

parameters.name: IncludeAllInstances
parameters.description: When true, includes the health status for all instances. When false, includes the health status for running instances only. Default: false.

nested_items.name: InstanceStatuses
nested_items.description: Information about the status of the instances.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone of the instance.

nested_items.name: OutpostArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.

nested_items.name: Managed
nested_items.description: If true, the resource is managed by a service provider.

nested_items.name: Principal
nested_items.description: If managed is true, then the principal is returned. The principal is the service provider that manages the resource.

nested_items.name: Events
nested_items.description: Any scheduled events associated with the instance.

nested_items.name: InstanceEventId
nested_items.description: The ID of the event.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: The event code.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the event.

nested_items.name: NotAfter
nested_items.description: The latest scheduled end time for the event.

nested_items.name: NotBefore
nested_items.description: The earliest scheduled start time for the event.

nested_items.name: NotBeforeDeadline
nested_items.description: The deadline for starting the event.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the instance.

nested_items.name: InstanceState
nested_items.description: The intended state of the instance.  DescribeInstanceStatus requires that an instance be in the running state.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: The state of the instance as a 16-bit unsigned integer.
0 : pending.
16 : running.
32 : shutting-down.
48 : terminated.
64 : stopping.
80 : stopped.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The current state of the instance.

nested_items.name: InstanceStatus
nested_items.description: Reports impaired functionality that stems from issues internal to the instance, such as impaired reachability.

nested_items.name: Details
nested_items.description: The system instance health or application instance health.

nested_items.name: ImpairedSince
nested_items.description: The time when a status check failed. For an instance that was launched and impaired, this is the time when the instance was launched.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The type of instance status.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status.

nested_items.name: SystemStatus
nested_items.description: Reports impaired functionality that stems from issues related to the systems that support an instance, such as hardware failures and network connectivity problems.

nested_items.name: Details
nested_items.description: The system instance health or application instance health.

nested_items.name: ImpairedSince
nested_items.description: The time when a status check failed. For an instance that was launched and impaired, this is the time when the instance was launched.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The type of instance status.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status.

nested_items.name: AttachedEbsStatus
nested_items.description: Reports impaired functionality that stems from an attached Amazon EBS volume that is unreachable and unable to complete I/O operations.

nested_items.name: Details
nested_items.description: Details about the attached EBS status check for an instance.

nested_items.name: ImpairedSince
nested_items.description: The date and time when the attached EBS status check failed.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the attached EBS status check.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The result of the attached EBS status check.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.
